subject: Swimming
lead_paragraph: Natalie Coughlin broke her world record in the 100-meter backstroke in a preliminary heat at the Missouri Grand Prix in Columbia. She won in 59.21 seconds, lowering her previous mark by 23-hundredths of a second, to finish ahead of Kirsty Coventry of Zimbabwe, who set a world record in the 200-meter backstroke Saturday.Katie Hoff set her second American record in two days when she cruised to victories in the 200 freestyle and the 400 individual medley. Michael Phelps, the six-time Olympic gold medalist, also won easily in the 200 freestyle and 400 individual medley.Hoff set an American record in the 200, finishing in 1 minute 56.08 seconds to defeat Coughlin for the second time in two days. Coughlin had set the previous mark. In Sunday’s medley, Hoff beat Coventry. With two events remaining on the final day of the Grand Prix on Monday, Hoff has won four races.
